The College Board
March 20 at 1:24 PM ·

We know the coronavirus has created challenges for AP students and teachers. Here’s how the College Board will support you during this time:

1️⃣ We’re providing free, live and on-demand AP courses

To support AP students affected by school closures due to COVID-19, students and schools will have access to live AP review lessons, delivered by AP teachers from across the country. Lessons will begin March 25.

2️⃣ We’re developing a new at-home testing option

Because of the challenges created by COVID-19, we’re developing a new at-home AP Exam option. Students will be able to test on a computer, tablet, or smartphone.

We will invest so that every AP student impacted by COVID-19 has the tools and connectivity they need to review AP content online and take the exam from home.

During this challenging time, we will work to give every AP student the opportunity to earn the college credit and placement they’ve been working toward all year while maintaining a focus on the health and safety of our AP community.

More details here: http://spr.ly/61851tbn3.

WEST MIDDLE SCHOOL IS A 2019 NATIONAL BLUE RIBBON SCHOOL

U.S. Secretary of Education Betsy DeVos announced that West Middle School has been named an Exemplary High Performing Schools 2019 National Blue Ribbon School. West is one of 362 public and private schools in the country, and only 12 in Indiana, receiving the Blue Ribbon designation this year. Schools are nominated for the award by the State Department of Education, and then complete a comprehensive application about school practices. The National Blue Ribbon Schools Program honors public and private elementary, middle and high schools where students achieve very high learning standards or are making notable improvements in closing the achievement gap. Congratulations to the students, staff, and families of West Middle School! This is the fourth consecutive BCSC school to achieve this honor: Reagan (2018), White Lick (2017), Brown (2016).

At tonight’s monthly meeting, the BCSC Board of School Trustees approved Julie Copeland as the new principal of Delaware Trail and Kyle Duncan as the BHS Assistant Athletic Director for 2019-2020. Copeland is pictured with her family and with members of the DT staff who attended in support. She is a 1999 BHS graduate and Brownsburg resident who has served as Instructional Coach at White Lick Elementary for the last eight years. This afternoon U.S. Secretary of Education Betsy DeVos announced that Reagan Elementary has been named a 2018 National Blue Ribbon School. Reagan is one of 349 public and private schools in the country, and only 7 in Indiana, receiving this honor. Schools are nominated for the award by the state department of education, and then complete a comprehensive application about school practices. The National Blue Ribbon Schools Program honors public and private elementary, middle and high schools where students achieve very high learning standards or are making notable improvements in closing the achievement gap.
Congratulations to the students, staff, and families of Reagan Elementary!

post_text: Today’s a day where the Brownsburg staff gets a little competitive while they raise money to support Brownsburg students and teachers.
